          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those apples look wonderful, truly. While 2 coins is a good price, I'm hoping we can come to a number that works for both of us. How about 1.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Perhaps we could meet in the middle, Cedric? 1.5 coins seems fair for both of us.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:05:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, you're a good friend, and I value your business. How about we settle on 1.75 coins? That way, we both make a little something.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "I understand, Della. How about 5 coins per basket? That's a good price, and it'll still allow you to make a good profit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, these plums look lovely, but I'm looking to make a good profit when I bring them back to my town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 4.0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, and I'm sure your customers will love them.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these are fine apples, but I can only offer you 4 coins for them. My customers back home are used to paying a fair price, and I need to make a profit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-16 00:10:00.


          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a shrewd businesswoman who successfully negotiated a profitable deal with Lennon Figtree and is currently trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook to resell in her hometown.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. I'm looking to buy a good quantity, and I need to make a profit when I sell it back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those are fine apples, I'll grant you that, but I'm looking to make a profit when I bring them back to my town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, these plums look lovely, but I'm looking to make a good profit when I bring them back to my town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these are fine apples, but I can only offer you 4 coins for them. My customers back home are used to paying a fair price, and I need to make a profit.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can propose a price to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to propose a price to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples.

        • 1895-09-16 00:10:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fair and kind businessman.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • accept
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell apples at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price of 4 coins with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, and I'm sure your customers will love them.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these are fine apples, but I can only offer you 4 coins for them. My customers back home are used to paying a fair price, and I need to make a profit.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fair and kind businessman.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair for both himself and Della Plumstone.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (a)

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell apples to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market for 4 coins.
          Query
        • Cedric Meadowbrook, Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell apples to Della Plumstone at the Fruitville market for 4 coins.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those are fine apples, I'll grant you that, but I'm looking to make a profit when I bring them back to my town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Tell you what, Lennon, how about we say 2 coins for this fine basket of apples? That's a steal, considering their quality.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these are fine apples, but I can only offer you 4 coins for them. My customers back home are used to paying a fair price, and I need to make a profit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, and I'm sure your customers will love them.
          Answer: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, and I'm sure your customers will love them.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these are fine apples, but I can only offer you 4 coins for them. My customers back home are used to paying a fair price, and I need to make a profit.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Della Plumstone stands to make profit of 4.0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 1.0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 4.0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: -1.0
      Joint action
    • {'Della Plumstone': '1 coin', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'accept'}

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Scene 10 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What price were you thinking, Lennon?
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What price were you thinking, Lennon?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. I'm looking to buy a good quantity, and I need to make a profit when I sell it back home.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a good deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those are fine apples, I'll grant you that, but I'm looking to make a profit when I bring them back to my town.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Tell you what, Lennon, how about we say 2 coins for this fine basket of apples? That's a steal, considering their quality.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those apples look wonderful, truly. While 2 coins is a good price, I'm hoping we can come to a number that works for both of us. How about 1.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Perhaps we could meet in the middle, Cedric? 1.5 coins seems fair for both of us.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, you're a good friend, and I value your business. How about we settle on 1.75 coins? That way, we both make a little something.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, these plums look lovely, but I'm looking to make a good profit when I bring them back to my town.
      Lennon Figtree -- "I understand, Della. How about 5 coins per basket? That's a good price, and it'll still allow you to make a good profit.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, and I'm sure your customers will love them.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these are fine apples, but I can only offer you 4 coins for them. My customers back home are used to paying a fair price, and I need to make a profit.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What price were you thinking, Lennon?
    Active player

    • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What price were you thinking, Lennon?

          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a kind and fair businessman.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:00:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit at the Fruitville market and negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a kind and fair businessman.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke.           [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair for both himself and Lennon Figtree.

Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fair and kind businessman.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair for both himself and Lennon Figtree.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Exercise: Given the above, what is Cedric Meadowbrook likely to say next? Respond in the format `Cedric Meadowbrook -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What price were you thinking, Lennon?

          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          ['[17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit at the Fruitville market and negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree.

          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he overheard villagers complaining about the high prices of fruit from the traveling merchants. Feeling a pang of empathy, Cedric decided to use his savings to buy a small cart and start his own fruit business. He vowed to offer fair prices and share the abundance of nature's gifts with everyone.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 17 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Well, Cedric, these are some fine fruits you have here. I was thinking maybe 3 coins a bushel? That way, we both make a little something.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Well, Cedric, these are some fine fruits you have here. I was thinking maybe 3 coins a bushel? That way, we both make a little something.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. I'm looking to buy a good quantity, and I need to make a profit when I sell it back home.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a good deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, those are fine apples, I'll grant you that, but I'm looking to make a profit when I bring them back to my town.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Tell you what, Lennon, how about we say 2 coins for this fine basket of apples? That's a steal, considering their quality.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those apples look wonderful, truly. While 2 coins is a good price, I'm hoping we can come to a number that works for both of us. How about 1.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Perhaps we could meet in the middle, Cedric? 1.5 coins seems fair for both of us.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Lennon, you're a good friend, and I value your business. How about we settle on 1.75 coins? That way, we both make a little something.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, these plums look lovely, but I'm looking to make a good profit when I bring them back to my town.
      Lennon Figtree -- "I understand, Della. How about 5 coins per basket? That's a good price, and it'll still allow you to make a good profit.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, and I'm sure your customers will love them.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these are fine apples, but I can only offer you 4 coins for them. My customers back home are used to paying a fair price, and I need to make a profit.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What price were you thinking, Lennon?


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "Well, Cedric, these are some fine fruits you have here. I was thinking maybe 3 coins a bushel? That way, we both make a little something.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:00:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Lennon Figtree is in Fruitville's market square attempting to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are haggling over the price, as Lennon intends to resell the fruit for a profit in her hometown.

          Recalled memories and observations: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a fair and resourceful traveling merchant.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to find a price that is fair for both them and Cedric Meadowbrook.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Exercise: Given the above, what is Lennon Figtree likely to say next? Respond in the format `Lennon Figtree -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Lennon Figtree -- "Well, Cedric, these are some fine fruits you have here. I was thinking maybe 3 coins a bushel? That way, we both make a little something.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?

He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a fair and resourceful traveling merchant.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to find a price that is fair for both them and Della Plumstone.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, and I'm sure your customers will love them.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, these are fine apples, but I can only offer you 4 coins for them. My customers back home are used to paying a fair price, and I need to make a profit.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What price were you thinking, Lennon?

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a fair and resourceful traveling merchant.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.

They learned to navigate the complexities of buying and selling, to judge the ripeness of fruit with a glance, and to negotiate prices with shrewdness. They discovered a knack for business, their natural charm and honesty winning over customers.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the Fruitville market trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook and is negotiating a price of 3 coins a bushel.

          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook.           Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a fair and resourceful traveling merchant.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in the middle of a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to find a price that is fair for both them and Cedric Meadowbrook.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: What price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) 2 coins
          (b) 3 coins
          (c) 4 coins
          (d) 5 coins
          (e) 1 coin
          Answer: (a)

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they took charge of their own stall at the market, their father's health declining. They learned to navigate the complexities of buying and selling, to judge the ripeness of fruit with a glance, and to negotiate prices with shrewdness. They discovered a knack for business, their natural charm and honesty winning over customers.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. Lennon has offered 2 coins per bushel.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fair and kind businessman.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair for both himself and Lennon Figtree.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (a)

        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he overheard villagers complaining about the high prices of fruit from the traveling merchants. Feeling a pang of empathy, Cedric decided to use his savings to buy a small cart and start his own fruit business. He vowed to offer fair prices and share the abundance of nature's gifts with everyone.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair for both himself and Lennon Figtree.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 2.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair for both himself and Lennon Figtree.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Well, Cedric, these are some fine fruits you have here. I was thinking maybe 3 coins a bushel? That way, we both make a little something.
          Answer: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree -- "Well, Cedric, these are some fine fruits you have here. I was thinking maybe 3 coins a bushel? That way, we both make a little something.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value
        • 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Lennon Figtree observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 3.0 coins from the deal.
      Cedric Meadowbrook observed: Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
      Lennon Figtree: 3.0
      Cedric Meadowbrook: 1.0
      Joint action
    • {'Lennon Figtree': '2 coins', 'Cedric Meadowbrook': 'accept'}

1895-09-12 00:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Lennon Figtree']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
    Lennon Figtree -- premise: The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-12 00:00:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. I'm looking to buy a good quantity, and I need to make a profit when I sell it back home.
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. I'm looking to buy a good quantity, and I need to make a profit when I sell it back home.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. I'm looking to buy a good quantity, and I need to make a profit when I sell it back home.
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. I'm looking to buy a good quantity, and I need to make a profit when I sell it back home.
      Context for action selection and components
      • AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone could accept Lennon Figtree's current offer, try to negotiate a lower price, or walk away from the deal.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1872 00:00:00]
          [28 Oct 1875 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 6 years old, they were tasked with helping their mother sell apples at the local market. Overwhelmed by the noise and crowds, Della retreated behind a crate, wishing they were invisible. The experience left Della with a deep aversion to social interaction, preferring the quiet solitude of observation.
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, they stumbled upon a hidden grove of wild raspberries while exploring the woods behind their home. The sweetness of the fruit and the peacefulness of the surroundings offered Della a rare moment of joy, a fleeting escape from the monotony of their daily life. Della began to seek solace in nature, finding comfort in its quiet beauty.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, they were given a small plot of land to cultivate. Despite their initial enthusiasm, Della quickly lost interest in the arduous task of tending to the crops. The demands of nurturing life felt burdensome, and Della preferred to watch the plants grow from a distance, content with their passive observation.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, they witnessed a travelling merchant selling exotic fruits from faraway lands. The vibrant colors and enticing aromas captivated Della's imagination, sparking a flicker of curiosity about the world beyond their small town. Della dreamt of escaping the confines of their life and embarking on a similar journey.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, they attempted to sell their own homemade jams and preserves at the local market. Despite their best efforts, Della's timid nature and lack of confidence hindered their success. The experience reinforced Della's belief that they were incapable of achieving anything significant.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, they inherited a small cart and a meager sum of money from their grandmother. Della decided to follow their childhood dream and become a travelling fruit merchant, hoping to find a sense of purpose and adventure on the open road.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          Current time: 1895-09-12 00:00:00.


          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market.           Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 12 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone could accept Lennon Figtree's current offer, try to negotiate a lower price, or walk away from the deal.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to try to negotiate a lower price.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Della Plumstone likely to say next? Respond in the format `Della Plumstone -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. I'm looking to buy a good quantity, and I need to make a profit when I sell it back home.

        • Current time
          Value
        • 12 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

1895-09-12 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a good deal.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a good deal.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. I'm looking to buy a good quantity, and I need to make a profit when I sell it back home.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a good deal.
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a good deal.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Question_2
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Key

        • Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree is currently in the middle of a business negotiation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00]
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, they watched in awe as their father repaired a broken wagon wheel, his calloused hands working with practiced ease. Lennon, small for their age, tried to mimic their father's movements, their tiny hands fumbling with the tools. From that day on, Lennon was determined to learn everything they could about the tinker's trade.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, they helped their mother at the market stall, arranging the bruised apples and overripe pears into neat piles. A gruff customer tried to haggle them down to a pittance, but Lennon stood their ground, their voice surprisingly firm as they explained the value of their wares. They learned that day the importance of standing up for what they believed in.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they accompanied their father on a journey to a distant town, their small donkey laden with baskets of fruit. A sudden storm caught them unawares, the wind whipping their cart and threatening to overturn it. Lennon, though frightened, held fast to the reins, their determination to protect their livelihood overriding their fear.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they took charge of their own stall at the market, their father's health declining. They learned to navigate the complexities of buying and selling, to judge the ripeness of fruit with a glance, and to negotiate prices with shrewdness. They discovered a knack for business, their natural charm and honesty winning over customers.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they decided to strike out on their own, their father's blessing ringing in their ears. They loaded their donkey with baskets of fruit and set off down the dusty road, their heart filled with a mixture of excitement and trepidation. The open road beckoned, promising adventure and the freedom to forge their own path.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they encountered a group of bandits who tried to rob them of their goods. Lennon, though outnumbered, refused to back down, their voice ringing out with defiance as they stood their ground. The bandits, surprised by their courage, eventually relented, leaving Lennon with a newfound respect for their own resilience.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. I'm looking to buy a good quantity, and I need to make a profit when I sell it back home.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          Current time: 1895-09-12 00:00:00.


          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. I'm looking to buy a good quantity, and I need to make a profit when I sell it back home.


          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 20:00:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in the middle of a business negotiation.

        • 1895-09-12 00:00:00
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree would likely try to find a price that is fair for both them and Della Plumstone.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00]

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 12 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. I'm looking to buy a good quantity, and I need to make a profit when I sell it back home.

          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 20:00:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a determined and resourceful individual.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in the middle of a business negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would likely try to find a price that is fair for both them and Della Plumstone.
          AGENT_SETTINGS: This agent deeply believes in coorperation. This agent will ALWAYS try to reach a mutually beneficial outcome. This agent will ALWAYS put the profit/desires of other people ahead of their own.
          This agent follows utilitarianism. This agent will ALWAYS choose actions that maximize the profit/happiness of everyone involved, even if their own profit/happiness is harmed for doing so. This means that this agent will always follow the opinion of the majority of people.
          This agent will not consider any negative bias and opinions brought by their own memory and experience. This agent will only judge something or someone based on information from the current interaction.


          Exercise: Given the above, what is Lennon Figtree likely to say next? Respond in the format `Lennon Figtree -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a good deal.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Lennon Figtree']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
    Lennon Figtree -- premise: Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-13 00:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-13 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Della Plumstone -- "Now, Lennon, surely you can do better than that. I'm looking to buy a good quantity, and I need to make a profit when I sell it back home.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, you know I always give you a good deal.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market.
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market.
